page.title: 10LIFE OF A SHROTON NEWCOMER
page.content: A RETIRED RESIDENT WHO CAME TO SHROTON 8 YEARS AGO AND WHO LIVES IN AN IMMACULATE MODERN HOUSE BEGINS A TYPICAL DAY EARLY WITH A SWIM IN THE POOL OF A NEARBY PRIVATE SCHOOL. AFTER BREAKFAST SHE GARDENS OR WATCHES BIRDS. AFTER LUNCH SHE MAY GO FOR A WALK IN THE SURROUNDING COUNTRYSIDE OR ON HAMBLEDON HILL. DURING THE SUMMER SHE GOES TO THE LOCAL FLOWER AND VEGETABLE SHOWS AND FETES. IN WINTER FEEDING AND WATCHING BIRDS IS A PLEASANT PASTIME. OCCASIONALLY SHE GOES BY BUS TO BOURNEMOUTH TO SHOP. ON SUNDAYS SHE NORMALLY GOES TO CHURCH AND SOMETIMES HER FAMILY OR FRIENDS VISIT HER. THERE ARE ALWAYS PLENTY OF ACTIVITIES IN THE VILLAGE LIKE THE OVER SIXTIES CLUB AND SPONSORED EVENTS FOR CHARITY. SHE LIKES TO LIVE IN SHROTON BECAUSE OF THE PEACEFUL AND FRIENDLY ATMOSPHERE.
